page.title: 06HISTORY OF CLEETHORPES
page.content: The{village of Clee}was built in{Saxon times 1.25 miles from the{River {Humber.}In Danish times,two daughter villages,Oole and Itterby were founded by the sea as the 'thorpes' of Clee. Clee Church dates from the early 11th Century.By the 1790s Cleethorpes was attracting{seaside visitors.}Even before the arrival of the{railway}in nearby Grimsby in 1848 crowds of {holidaymakers}were coming by{coach}and {steam packet.}The enclosure of the parish in 1846 made more land available for building.The Manchester Sheffield and Lincolnshire Railway Company built a line to Cleethorpes in 1863;helped build the{pier}in 1873 and the{promenade}and{gardens}in 1885. Grimsby docks were opened in 1852 and Cleethorpes became a dormitory suburb. {Amusements}were added in the 1890s. Cleethorpes became a borough in 1936.
